content: Credit Card DBS Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Jun 2019I recently got rejected for my DBS cc application, was thinking if its alright to reapply after a month. Any advice? Facts are as stated below! Thank you :)?Earn ~2,350, started July18Have 13 mth, received half month as prorated (Jul-Dec 18)Contract states entitled to 13 mth, but contract for 3 years (till 2021) before deciding if can continue or leave (will this affect?)Before application, balance was 1,000, normally transfer savings to OCBCCredit Bureau say my report was not taken by bank, so probably means income/bank balance previously not enough is it?Have now transferred 20,000 back to DBS hoping will help reapplication6 answersAnswerBump0

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardUpdated on 24 Jun 2019The most straighforward way would be to check with DBS to see why it was rejected.
Based on the data points you provided, it might be the case that they want to see a full 12 months of income, and you are just shy of a month.2 comments2

Question Poster24 Jun 2019Yea i called and emailed them but they say for cc rejections they are unable to disclose the reason for the decline :/ they mentioned that it was like an internal thing which they do not disclose to us hmm. Yea i was thinking of waiting for my July pay to be in before trying to apply again as there will be a small increment hahahJunus Eu24 Jun 2019Yes, and perhaps wait a little longer if you can. On the side, no harm sussing out the credit card promoters and casually ask! They won't be able to tell you specifically for your case, but I'm sure in their line they do see the common reasons for rejected applications.
